deals.highlightsHtml: Sip cocktails and play table games into the wee hours at this chic Las Vegas hotel just off the Strip
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: The D Las Vegas

The D Las Vegas supplies games, glitz, and entertainment just north of the Vegas Strip. Day and night, cocktails are served at the hotel’s lounges as well as at the casino, which offers slot machines and table games. If you need to recharge, take a dip amid sun-kissed palm trees in the outdoor pool and hot tub.

  • Luck be a lady: Old-timey slot machines and simulated horse races are some of the quirky ways to play at the hotel’s casino. Table games and late-night keno are also available.
  • Sleek decor and bold red and black accents give guest rooms an upscale ambiance. Some rooms have panoramic views of the mountains.
  • Diverse dining: Sink your teeth into prime cuts of steak and Italian entrees at Andiamo Steakhouse or satisfy late-night cravings at the laid-back American Coney Island.
  • Grab a martini or frozen margarita at three onsite bars. Dancing servers entertain guests at D Bar.

Beyond the Las Vegas Strip: Old Vegas and Red Rock Canyon

It can feel like the entire city of Las Vegas revolves around the Strip if you never venture beyond that neon-lit corridor. But there’s plenty to see and do once you step off Las Vegas Boulevard. You can find a taste of Old Vegas on Fremont Street, where vintage signs and showgirls crowned with headdresses recall the days of Sinatra and Martin. Beginning at dusk, a canopy of more than 12 million LED lights erupts in a psychedelic light-and-music show every hour. For an aerial view, zoom down the center of Fremont Street on a zipline.

Nature puts on its own show at Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area, a landscape of fiery-red sandstone formations and limestone cliffs just 17 miles outside the city. Motor down the 13-mile scenic drive or ditch the car and strike out on any of more than 20 hiking trails that course through the region’s otherworldly topography.

deals.highlightsHtml: Stay on the Las Vegas Strip at a hotel with two pools, several restaurants, and a 15,000 sq. ft. casino
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: Flamingo Las Vegas

Wandering around the 15,000 square feet of casino, you could lose yourself amid more than 1,600 slot and multiple table games. Good thing your room’s just upstairs at Flamingo Las Vegas. It’s in a prime spot at the Center of the Strip, adjacent to The LINQ Promenade and the High Roller - the world’s tallest observation wheel. Rooms even offer views of the observation wheel and high-definition flat-screen TVs.

  • Treat yourself with a stay in a newly renovated Flamingo room which is inspired by a fresh and modern take on the historical Flamingo.
  • Wildlife Habitat: This 15-acre onsite park is home to exotic fish, turtles, and birds, including flamingos.
  • Showtime: music, comedy, and magic shows with performers like Donny & Marie
  • Eat up: Choose from several restaurants, including an upscale Center Cut Steakhouse and Paradise Garden Buffet, where where bottomless mimosas are included with your brunch buffet vouchers.

The Las Vegas Strip: 24/7 Entertainment and Fine Dining

With an almost unlimited variety of casinos, bars and nightclubs, and live entertainment, the general consensus along the Las Vegas Strip seems to be “go big or go home.” And you can go really big here. Make a beeline for the dozens of 24-hour casinos lining the neon-lit Strip to tango with Lady Luck in high-stakes games of roulette, blackjack, and poker; or grab a front-row seat to the city’s over-the-top glitz at nightly magic, acrobatic, and musical performances. Be sure to stick around for mealtimes—casinos on the Strip are known for their fine-dining restaurants and extravagant buffets overflowing with crab legs and prime rib.

Even Sin City isn’t all casinos, all the time. Go shopping at the high-end boutiques found inside most hotels on the Las Vegas Strip, or head to Fashion Show Las Vegas to browse racks at Neiman Marcus, Macy’s, and Saks Fifth Avenue. You can also virtually travel the globe in just a few city blocks, thanks to the Strip’s re-creation of the Statue of Liberty, the Eiffel Tower, and Venetian canals. And you’ll find a surprising number of shows in Las Vegas for kids hidden among the raucous nightlife.

deals.highlightsHtml: Roaring Twenties hotel with direct casino access and indoor pool, located steps from the Atlantic City Boardwalk
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: The Claridge Hotel

A 1920’s-era hotel that was once nicknamed the “Skyscraper of the Sea,” The Claridge Hotel recently returned to the Atlantic City Boardwalk with a slew of updated amenities. The hotel’s choice location puts guests just minutes from the beach and shopping destinations.

  • Glitzy history: Built in 1929, The Claridge Hotel has hosted such celebrities as Marilyn Monroe, Al Capone, and Frank Sinatra. It’s one of the oldest remaining skyscrapers from Atlantic City’s early boom, and channels the Roaring Twenties feel popularized by the TV show Boardwalk Empire.
  • Where you’ll stay: Recently renovated guest rooms feature complimentary WiFi and Keurig coffeemakers. Book the jetted-tub king room to enjoy the added perks of a jetted tub and two welcome drinks at VUE Rooftop Bar.
  • Hit the jackpot at Bally’s Casino, directly accessible from the hotel.
  • Take a dip in the indoor pool.
  • Break a sweat in the fitness center.

Atlantic City, New Jersey: Casinos and Carnival Rides Lining Historical Beachside Boardwalk

No trip to Atlantic City is complete without a stroll along its signature boardwalk, which stretches for 6 miles along New Jersey’s eastern coast. Originally built in 1870 to keep sand out of hotel lobbies, the boardwalk grew in popularity as a place where you could drink and gamble during Prohibition without much trouble from the police, as depicted in HBO’s Boardwalk Empire. The boardwalk is still popular for its casinos, but it’s family-friendly, too; visitors are just as inclined to sit at the beach or stop at one of the many carnival rides.

On the boardwalk, it’s worth it to check out the Absecon Lighthouse, which is more than 150 years old. It’s possible to climb its 228 steps to the top, which features sweeping views of the city skyline and the sea.

deals.highlightsHtml: This Nob Hill hotel has free nightly wine tastings and WiFi
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: Executive Hotel Vintage Court

Executive Hotel Vintage Court is located in upscale Nob Hill, one of San Francisco’s most iconic neighborhoods. But much of the hotel experience calls to mind the vineyards of the Napa and Sonoma Valleys. Each executive room is named for a California winery, and each day, the hotel holds complimentary wine tastings highlighting reds and whites from nearby producers.

  • Swirl, sniff, sip: A concierge is on hand to give you tips on local wineries.
  • In-room amenities: free WiFi, cable TV, and luxurious bathrobes
  • Perfect spot: the hotel is located near Union Square, Chinatown, the famous Cable Cars, and the Financial District.

Nob Hill, San Francisco: Fashionable Neighborhood with Scenic City Views

One of the original seven hills on which the city was built, Nob Hill is a fashionable, upscale neighborhood once referred to as a “Hill of Palaces” because of its many estates. Huntington Park is the centerpiece of the district, and it’s bordered by Grace Cathedral, a beautiful Gothic-style building with colorful mosaics and a replica of the medieval labyrinth in France’s Cathedral of Our Lady of Chartres.

San Francisco’s iconic cable cars head up and down the streets of Nob Hill and neighboring Russian Hill. The nearby Cable Car Museum fills visitors in on the history of the iconic San Francisco tradition. They can hop on cable cars and head north to reach Ghirardelli Square’s high-end boutiques and Pier 39’s seafood restaurants, or east to see Chinatown—one of the largest Chinese communities outside of Asia.

deals.highlightsHtml: A mix of ancient and modern sites makes Greece a hot-spot destination for luxury and adventurous travelers; air is included
deals.pitchHtml:
Affordable World: 20,000+ of our travelers served since 2013.

Vacation in Greece with Airfare

On this multi-stop vacation in Greece, you’ll get to see every side of the country. First up: the bustling ancient capital city, Athens. Thanks to its vibrant nightlife, tropical weather, and modern museums, Athens has remained a world-class travel destination well into modern times. The next stop is the famed Greek island Santorini (8-day trip) or isles Mykonos and Santorini (10-day trip). Both are regularly ranked among the world’s best island destinations by Travel + Leisure for their stunning beauty and quaint villages. This vacation from Affordable World includes:

Flights & Transportation:

  • Round-trip airfare from
    • Nonstop flights available from EWR on Emirates Airlines
    • Washington, DC (IAD)
    • Los Angeles (LAX)
    • Houston (IAH)
    • San Francisco (SFO)
  • Transportation between each city via ferry
  • Round-trip airport transfers
  • Airline taxes & fuel surcharges
  • Airline & flight times determined at time of booking

Hotels for Athens & Santorini Itinerary (6 nights + 1 overnight flight)

  • 3 nights of accommodations at Titania Hotel, St George Lycabettus Hotel, Athenaeum Grand Hotel, or similar in Athens
  • 3 nights of accommodations at Splendour Resort or similar in Santorini

Hotels for Athens, Mykonos, & Santorini Itinerary (8 nights + 1 overnight flight)

  • 3 nights of accommodations at the Titania Hotel, Athenaeum Grand Hotel, Metropolitan Hotel Athens, Athens Avenue Hotel, President Hotel, or similar in Athens
  • 2 nights of accommodations at San Antonio Summerland, San Marco Hotel, Porto Mykonos Hotel, Madalena Hotel, Petinos Beach Hotel, Madoupa Boutique Hotel, or similar in Mykonos
  • 3 nights of accommodations at El Greco Hotel, Santorini Palace, Santo Miramare Resort, Aegean Plaza Hotel, Rose Bay Hotel, or similar in Santorini

Attractions & Meals

  • Daily breakfast
  • Professional English-speaking tour guide
  • Orientation tour in each city
  • Admission to sightseeing places as indicated in the itinerary
  • City tours:
    • Athens tour with admission to the Acropolis (view Erechtheion and Parthenon) and the Acropolis Museum; pass by the city center, Hadrian’s Arch, the Temple of Olympian Zeus, and the Panathenaic Stadium
    • Mykonos walking tour; highlights include the old port and famous windmills
    • Santorini walking tour; highlights include Fira and Imerovigli

Optional Tours

  • Afternoon Cape Sounion trip ($56 per person, 8- and 10-day itinerary)
  • Caldera sailing tour at sunset ($104 per person; 8- and 10-day itinerary)
  • Santorini landmarks tour ($54 per person; only 8-day itinerary)
  • Delos island tour ($69 per person; only 10-day itinerary)
  • Caldera daytime sailing tour ($104 per person; only 10-day itinerary)

Hotel Upgrades:

8-day Itinerary:

  • Upgrade to the NJV Athens Plaza Hotel (Athens - 3 Nights): from $189 per person based on double occupancy

10-day Itinerary

  • Upgrade to the NJV Athens Plaza Hotel (Athens - 3 Nights): from $189 per person based on double occupancy
  • Upgrade to BOHEME Mykonos (Mykonos - 2 Nights): from $99 per person based on double occupancy
  • Upgrade to the Petasos Beach Hotel (Mykonos - 2 Nights): from $99 per person based on double occupancy
  • Upgrade to the Majestic Hotel (Santorini - 3 Nights): from $239 per person based on double occupancy

Flights and Ferry Upgrades

  • Roundtrip flights instead of ferries from Athens-Santorini, Santorini-Athens (from $169 per person; only 8-day itinerary)
  • Upgrade to business class on Athens-Santorini, Santorini-Athens ferries (from $39 per person; only 8-day itinerary)
  • One-way flight instead of a ferry from Santorini-Athens (from $139 per person; only 10-day itinerary)
  • Upgrade to business class on Athens-Mykonos, Mykonos-Santorini, Santorini-Athens ferries (from $49 per person; only 10-day itinerary)

How to Book

1. Choose package, departure city and dates from drop-down menus or “See Options” button.
2. Complete your order; a confirmation email is sent after your order processes.
3. Book your trip: Go to your account to view your voucher for Affordable World Tours contact and redemption instructions. Book by 4/18/18.

Each person must buy a voucher; price is based on two people traveling together and sharing a room. Additional $400 fee for 8-day/6-night tour of Athens & Santorini package or $475 (May 2018 dates), $675 (June–August, October 2018 dates) and $700 (September 2018) fee for 10-day/8-night tour of Athens, Mykonos, & Santorini package to travel solo

What You Get

Frequently Asked Questions

1. Can we extend our trip before or after the promotional dates for the deal? Yes, you have the option to extend your trip at the end of the tour for a supplemental deviation fee of $100 per person. Airlines surcharge fee may apply. Airport transfer out and hotel accommodation not included.

2. How do I find out if the dates I want to travel are available? As long as the voucher shows the particular date can be purchased, then it is available.

3. What happens if I buy the voucher and my travel dates are not available? After you purchase the voucher, please redeem by making the reservation as soon as possible.

4. Does my child need a voucher, and can they stay in my room? The maximum number of adults that can stay in one room is two. One child can stay with two parents in the same room. Children will require a voucher in order to travel with parents.

deals.title: Stay with Daily Water Park Passes at Great Wolf Lodge Bloomington in Minnesota. Dates into July.
deals.announcementTitle: Great Wolf Lodge Water Park Resort near Minneapolis
deals.finePrint: Dates cannot be changed once booked; valid only for night(s) purchased. 4-day cancellation notice required prior to check-in or reservation is non-refundable; reservations made within cancellation window are non-refundable. No-shows will be charged total Groupon rate. No refunds will be processed by Groupon after check-in. Traveler name must match ID at time of check-in. Must have one individual 21+ staying in each room. Credit card required at check-in. Must provide email address at checkout, which will be provided to Great Wolf Lodge. $29.99 daily resort fee plus tax added at purchase. Two night offers includes $25 worth of dining credit per stay.
deals.highlightsHtml: Up to six guests enjoy daily passes to the indoor water park, plus access to kid-friendly activities and eight restaurants
deals.pitchHtml:
About Your Great Wolf Lodge Getaway

Travel Dates

  • Book to stay between April 11 and July 5.
  • Prices vary by day; the price listed is the lowest possible and may not be available all days.
  • Click on a date on the booking calendar to see the individual prices by day.

Inclusions

  • Daily water park passes for each registered guest, up to the maximum room occupancy, are included in all options.

See additional details regarding room occupancy, water park passes, and more on the Fine Print & Details tab above. See FAQs here.

Property at a Glance: Great Wolf Lodge Bloomington

The heart and soul of Great Wolf Lodge Bloomington is its 75,000-square-foot indoor water park. Splashy rides such as River Canyon Run—a four-story raft water slide—and a zero-depth-entry wave pool with 3-foot swells surround the park’s iconic hub: a four-story treehouse with a 1,000-gallon tipping bucket. Younger kids will have a blast with the gentle spray features of Cub Paw Pool.

The water park, which hovers around 84 degrees all year long, isn’t the resort’s only family-friendly activity. You’ll also find an arcade with more than 100 games and Scooops Boutique, where visitors can get fun nail polish and glitter tattoos.

  • Extended and exclusive water park access: You can enter the water park at 1 p.m. on the day you check in and stay until close on the day you check out (essentially 2 days’ water park admission). And since there are no day passes for outside visitors, resort guests have exclusive access and won’t get stuck in long lines.
  • Family-friendly fun: The resort has games and activities for kids of all ages. Explore options by age group here.
  • Hands-on crafts and activities such as face painting and balloon twisting during the Lunch Time Lineup can keep kids entertained when they want a break from the water park action.
  • Roomy suites comfortably sleep up to six guests. Some suites offer extra privacy with enclosed bunk beds.
  • Fuel up with food and drinks at eight restaurants and snack bars.
  • Add a Paw Pass or Pup Pass to your stay to enjoy kid-friendly activities and sweets at Creation Station, Oliver’s Mining Co., and more at a discounted rate. See everything that’s included—as well as other available packages—here (additional fees apply).
  • Safety first: Complimentary life jackets in multiple sizes and trained lifeguards help keep families safe and secure.
  • Distance from Minneapolis: 10 miles

Our Guide to Great Wolf Lodge

Eight Ways to Make the Most of Your Great Wolf Lodge Vacation

Our best tips on how to avoid crowds, dine on a budget, and dress down at Great Wolf Lodge

deals.highlightsHtml: Up to seven guests enjoy daily passes to the indoor water park, plus access to kid-friendly activities and eight restaurants
deals.pitchHtml:
About Your Great Wolf Lodge Getaway

Travel Dates

  • Book to stay between April 11 and July 5.
  • Prices vary by day; the price listed is the lowest possible and may not be available all days.
  • Click on a date on the booking calendar to see the individual prices by day.

Inclusions

  • Daily water park passes for each registered guest, up to the maximum room occupancy, are included in all options.

See additional details regarding room occupancy, water park passes, and more on the Fine Print & Details tab above. See FAQs here.

Property at a Glance: Great Wolf Lodge Colorado Springs

The heart and soul of Great Wolf Lodge Colorado Springs is its 50,000-square-foot indoor water park. Splashy rides such as the Howlin’ Tornado—an enclosed water slide that shoots you through a six-story funnel—and a zero-depth-entry wave pool with 3-foot swells surround the park’s iconic hub: a four-story treehouse with a huge tipping bucket. Younger kids will have a blast with the water slides and gentle spray features of Whooping Hollow and Cub Paw Pool.

The water park, which hovers around 84 degrees all year long, isn’t the resort’s only family-friendly activity. You’ll also find mini bowling at Ten Paw Alley, Howl in One Mini Golf, and Scooops Kid Spa.

  • Extended and exclusive water park access: You can enter the water park at 1 p.m. on the day you check in and stay until close on the day you check out (essentially 2 days’ water park admission). And since there are no day passes for outside visitors, resort guests have exclusive access and won’t get stuck in long lines.
  • Family-friendly fun: Enjoy games and activities for kids of all ages. Explore all activities by age group here.
  • Hands-on crafts and activities such as face painting and balloon twisting during the Lunch Time Lineup can entertain young children when they want a break from the water park action.
  • Roomy suites comfortably sleep up to seven people. Some suites provide extra privacy with enclosed bunk beds.
  • Climb through obstacles and balance on rope bridges 30 feet off the ground at the indoor Howlers Peak Ropes Course.
  • Fuel up with food and drinks at eight restaurants and snack bars.
  • Add a Paw Pass or Pup Pass to your stay to enjoy kid-friendly activities and sweets at Creation Station, Oliver’s Mining Co., and more at a discounted rate. See everything that’s included—as well as other available packages—here (additional fees apply).
  • Safety first: Complimentary life jackets in multiple sizes and trained life guards help keep families safe and secure.
  • Distance from Denver: about a one-hour drive

Our Guide to Great Wolf Lodge

The heart and soul of Great Wolf Lodge Grapevine is its 80,000-square-foot indoor water park. Younger kids will have a blast with the water slides and gentle spray features of Whooping Hollow and Cub Paw Pool.

The water park, which hovers around 84 degrees all year long, isn’t the resort’s only family-friendly activity. You’ll also find an arcade with more than 100 games and Scooops Kid Spa, where visitors can get pedicures while enthroned in a chair shaped like an ice-cream sundae.

  • Extended and exclusive water park access: You can enter the water park at 1 p.m. on the day you check in and stay until close on the day you check out (essentially 2 days’ water park admission). And since there are no day passes for outside visitors, resort guests have exclusive access and won’t get stuck in long lines.

deals.highlightsHtml: A comfortable hotel close to Detroit Metropolitan Airport with a free shuttle and a complimentary continental breakfast
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: Travelodge Romulus Detroit Airport

The Travelodge Romulus Detroit Airport is about as close as you can stay to Detroit’s airport without sleeping on a plane. This convenient hotel features traveler-friendly amenities and is less than a half hour’s drive from the museums and nightlife of downtown Detroit.

  • Complimentary breakfast: cereals, coffee, and juice
  • Comfortable guest rooms feature microwaves, mini refrigerators, and free WiFi.
  • Downtown Detroit is just 20 miles from the hotel, a quick drive on I-94.

Detroit: World-Class Museums and Revitalization Projects in the Motor City

The Motor City has certainly seen better days, but if you’re willing to look, you can still find a lot of worthwhile things to do and see. The downtown area has many top-flight cultural institutions and museums, and an influx of young people and artists are working to revitalize the city.

The 658,000-square-foot Detroit Institute of Arts, located downtown, comprises 100 galleries, an auditorium, a lecture hall, and a reference library. Among its vast collection: a dragon-tile relief from the Ishtar Gate of Babylon and a self-portrait of Vincent van Gogh. One of the city’s most fascinating art displays can’t be found at a museum or gallery. Tyree Guyton’s The Heidelberg Project is two blocks of once-decrepit houses that have been transformed into an open-air art installation, with colorful sculptures made out of discarded items including stuffed animals, vinyl records, old shoes, and scrap metal.

deals.highlightsHtml: The renovated Niagara Falls hotel is minutes from Horseshoe Falls; stay include wine and chocolate tastings, and dining and activity credits
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: Ramada Plaza Niagara Falls

This renovated hotel is less than 4 miles from thunderous Horseshoe Falls and even closer to many of Niagara Falls’ most popular attractions. It’s set on Lundy’s Lane, a hub for entertainment venues, shops, and restaurants. Head here to use your Canada One Brand Name Outlets discount card, included with this Getaway.

  • Included activities and discounts: With this Getaway, you’ll get a Chocolate FX tour and tasting, two-for-one admission to Bird Kingdom, and a discount at an IMAX theater.
  • Drink local with included tastings at two wineries, discounted tastings at another two, and one tasting at a brewery.
  • Start the day right with the included buy one breakfast and get second breakfast for 50% off at Don Cherry’s Sports Grill.
  • Save money on dinner: Enjoy “The Scratch Kitchen” dining credit at the Flour Mill Restaurant or dig into hearty steak at Meat Market Niagara, where you’ll get a C$20 dining credit. Both credits are valid with the purchase of at least two entrees. You’ll also get 10% discount at Don Cherry’s Sports Grill.
  • Try your luck at Seneca Casino Resort, Niagara Falls NY, with the included C$25 slot-play credit, per person per stay (guests must be 21+ to enter casino).
  • Have some fun: your stay includes admission for up to four to Clifton Hill Fun Zone (C$5 plus tax per person paid at time of redemption).
  • In-room amenities: city views, microwaves, refrigerators, and LCD TVs.
  • Go swimming in any weather with a dip in one of two indoor pools.

Niagara Falls, Ontario: Panoramic Views of the Falls near Vegas-Style Casinos and Water Parks

At Niagara Falls, water thunders downward from a height of nearly 200 feet, crashing onto craggy boulders below. The falls straddle the border between Canada and the United States, but the Canadian side of the Niagara River is universally hailed as the finest vantage point to take in all three of Niagara Falls’ photogenic brinks: American, Bridal Veil, and Horseshoe Falls.

Hornblower cruises ferry raincoat-clad passengers around the base of the falls from April to October, depending on the river’s ice conditions. Year-round, Journey Behind the Falls grants a glimpse behind the curtain of Horseshoe Falls—visitors board an elevator that descends 150 feet into the bedrock, then stand at an observation deck steps from the cascading water. A 10-minute walk from the falls is the neon-lit Clifton Hill neighborhood. Its Fallsview Boulevard has plenty of Vegas-style kitsch, including glitzy casinos and indoor water parks.

deals.highlightsHtml: Ride water slides or float down a lazy river at this resort’s 60,000-square-foot water park, located an hour north of the Wisconsin Dells
deals.pitchHtml:
Resort at a Glance: Three Bears Resort

The centerpiece of Three Bears Resort is its sprawling 60,000-square-foot water park. The indoor portion of the park features exhilarating tube slides and body racing courses, as well as slower-paced attractions such as a lazy river and wave pools. From Memorial Day to Labor Day, the outdoor section of the park welcomes visitors to zoom down slides shaped like whimsical mushrooms and frogs. Guests can also lounge in two hot tubs, including an indoor-outdoor tub whose halves are accessible by a swim-through tunnel.

  • In-room amenities include flat-screen TVs and free WiFi.
  • Woosh down the slides at the onsite water park. Tickets are included with your stay.
  • Onsite dining options include a pub, lounge, pizzeria, and coffee and sweet shop.

Regular Waterpark Hours:

  • Monday - Thursday: 4 p.m. - 9 p.m.: Children’s Pool & Activity Pool. Please note; Wavepool, Lazy River and Slides will not be open during this time
  • Friday: 5 p.m. - 9 p.m.: Entire park is open
  • Saturday: 9 a.m. - 9 p.m.: Entire park is open
  • Sunday: 9 a.m. - 1 p.m.: Entire park is open
  • 4 p.m. - 9 p.m.: Children’s Pool & Activity Pool
  • For Spring Break waterpark hours, please visit http://www.threebearsresort.com/

deals.pitchHtml:
Property at a Glance: TRYP by Wyndham Miami Bay Harbor

From atop its rooftop terrace, during your stay at TRYP by Wyndham Miami Bay Harbor you can drink in palm-tree-framed panoramic views of the Miami skyline, as well as the surrounding waterways. Catch glimpses of the Atlantic Ocean while floating in the terrace’s pool, or gaze out at the bay while letting stress evaporate in the hot tub.

  • Hit the beach at either Bal Harbour or Surfside—both located less than a mile away.
  • Peruse the boutiques while enjoying the sunshine in the open-air Bal Harbour shops just a few blocks from the hotel.
  • Squeeze in a workout day or night in the fitness center open 24 hours a day, seven day a week.
  • Bring the kids: All guests ages 17 and younger stay for free.

Miami Beach, Florida: White-Sand Beaches, Glamorous Nightlife, and Cuban Cuisine

Miami Beach is a small barrier island situated between the Atlantic Ocean and Biscayne Bay, a shallow lagoon that separates the beaches from downtown Miami. People from all over the world come here to enjoy the white-sand beaches, shop the high-end boutiques, and party at the legendary see-and-be-seen nightclubs the city is known for. The red-hot center of this sexy, international social scene is South Beach, a 20-block stretch filled with upscale lounges, rooftop bars, and ultrahip hangouts behind velvet ropes. Lummus Park beach is packed by mid-morning, and the clubs on Ocean Drive and Washington Avenue—many of which stay open until 5 a.m.—vie for the limelight with VIP service, celebrity DJs, and dressed-to-the-nines crowds.

Beyond the fast-paced luxury of South Beach lies Miami Beach’s softer side. A leisurely stroll through the Art Deco District reveals hundreds of beautiful, candy-colored buildings, including Versace Mansion—a 1930 manor modeled after a palace in the Dominican Republic that belonged to Christopher Columbus’s family. The centerpiece of the city’s arts scene, the Bass Museum of Art displays works from Peter Paul Rubens and Sandro Botticelli, and modern-design objects and propaganda arts fill three stories at the Wolfsonian-FIU museum. There’s also a handful of vibrant ethnic enclaves to explore here, and Little Havana is among the most notable. The neighborhood is lined with family-owned restaurants and Caribbean-style marketplaces, making it a great place to discover some of the country’s most delicious Cuban food, from sugary guarapo juice to pastelitos, or Cuban pastries.

merchant.name: TRYP by Wyndham Miami Bay Harbor

deals.highlightsHtml: Hotel just 20 minutes from Minneapolis treats guests to a free shuttle to the mall and the airport
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: GuestHouse Inn Bloomington

GuestHouse Inn Bloomington makes it simple to visit downtown Minneapolis. The city’s galleries and museums are just a 20-minute drive away.

  • In-room amenities: mini fridges and free WiFi
  • Best way to start the day: with a free continental breakfast that includes pastries, cereals, and fruits
  • Where to unwind: the indoor heated pool and jetted tub, which are open no matter the weather

Downtown Minneapolis: Thriving Performing-Arts Scene near Idyllic Lakes

Downtown Minneapolis is more than just the geographic epicenter of the city—it’s the cultural heart too. Sports venues home to the Timberwolves, Vikings, and Twins neighbor the lively nightclubs of the Warehouse District and the neon-lit marquees of the Hennepin Theater District. In recent years, the city’s arts scene has gotten a lot of attention, and for good reason: Minneapolis has more live theater shows per capita than any other US city except New York. Additionally, dozens of eclectic galleries complement the wide-ranging exhibits at the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, which showcases everything from Japanese woodcut prints to turn-of-the-century European advertisements.

To navigate downtown with ease, step into the Skyway, the city’s ingenious solution to harsh Minnesota winters. The Skyway is a network of indoor, aboveground tunnels connecting a slew of buildings downtown. A popular stop along the way is Nicollet Mall, a shopping thoroughfare where cars are not allowed. This is where you’ll find the iconic statue of Mary Tyler Moore tossing her 10-gallon Stetson into the air.

deals.highlightsHtml: Hotel near downtown Knoxville, University of Tennessee, and the Great Smoky Mountains; stay includes free WiFi and hot continental breakfast
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Knoxville

If you like to pair outdoor adventures with big-city attractions, consider Knoxville and the Great Smoky Mountains. This hotel puts you within 40 miles of the national park and just 10 miles from downtown Knoxville, where you can dive into the town’s bluegrass scene, try its famous biscuits, and visit the iconic Sunsphere.

  • Where you’ll stay: Spacious guest rooms feature free WiFi and beds swathed in signature Dream Well bedding.
  • Most important meal of the day: The hotel’s complimentary breakfast spread includes fresh muffins and pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, toasts, waffles, coffee, and tea.
  • Many restaurants and shops are within walking distance of the hotel.
  • Stuff to do: Catch a show at the Clarence Brown Theatre or lock eyes with a western lowland gorilla at the Knoxville Zoo.

Knoxville, Tennessee: College Town near the Great Smoky Mountains

The Tennessee River cuts right through the middle of Knoxville, and along its banks lies one of the cornerstones of the city: the University of Tennessee campus. The university’s football team, the Tennessee Volunteers (or “Vols”), has won six national championships since their first season in 1891. They play right on campus in Neyland Stadium, a beast of a venue that can hold more than 100,000 fans. Not to be outdone, the women’s basketball team has won eight national championships and are a perennial powerhouse. It’s largely thanks to the Lady Vols’ success that Knoxville was chosen as the site for the Women’s Basketball Hall of Fame.

But there’s more to Knoxville than its fabled athletic programs. In 1982, it hosted the World’s Fair, which produced perhaps the city’s most recognizable landmark: the Sunsphere, a giant, shimmering golden ball on top of a tower. From World’s Fair Park downtown, you can walk to Market Square, which features boutiques, restaurants, and a seasonal farmers’ market. A few blocks away, the opulent Tennessee Theatre hosts musical acts, touring Broadway shows, and classic films.

merchant.name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Knoxville

deals.highlightsHtml: This 4-star Hilton hotel has views of the city and Niagara Falls; each stay includes WiFi, dining credits, and wine tastings
deals.pitchHtml:
You’re viewing a property from our Premium Collection, a selection of top properties that are guaranteed to have a rating of 4 stars or higher.

Hotel at a Glance: Hilton Niagara Falls/Fallsview Hotel & Suites

Every day, about 200 billion liters of water surge over Canada’s Horseshoe Falls, the largest of Niagara’s three cascades. At ground level, there’s a thunderous roar, and a massive cloud of mist rises high above the brink. While staying at the 4-star Hilton Niagara Falls/Fallsview Hotel & Suites, you’ll be able to see the whole thing right from the hotel’s windows.

  • Room with a view: Guest rooms feature flat-screen TVs and windows overlooking either the city or the falls.
  • 3,000 slot machines fill Fallsview Casino Resort, which is connected to the hotel by a glass walkway.
  • Included in your stay: daily WiFi, breakfast voucher, tour and tastings at wineries, and a dinner voucher for Brasa Brazilian Steakhouse or Watermark Restaurant
  • Onsite nightlife: Sip drinks in the heart of Niagara’s Entertainment district at Spyce Lounge with live entertainment nightly.
  • Prestigious award: AAA’s Four Diamond Award

Niagara Falls, Ontario: Panoramic Views of the Falls near Vegas-Style Casinos and Water Parks

At Niagara Falls, water thunders downward from a height of nearly 200 feet, crashing onto craggy boulders below. The falls straddle the border between Canada and the United States, but the Canadian side of the Niagara River is universally hailed as the finest vantage point to take in all three of Niagara Falls’ photogenic brinks: American, Bridal Veil, and Horseshoe Falls.

Hornblower cruises ferry raincoat-clad passengers around the base of the falls from April to October, depending on the river’s ice conditions. Year-round, Journey Behind the Falls grants a glimpse behind the curtain of Horseshoe Falls—visitors board an elevator that descends 150 feet into the bedrock, then stand at an observation deck steps from the cascading water. A 10-minute walk from the falls is the neon-lit Clifton Hill neighborhood. Its Fallsview Boulevard has plenty of Vegas-style kitsch, including glitzy casinos and indoor water parks.

merchant.name: Hilton Niagara Falls/Fallsview Hotel & Suites - Premium Collection

deals.highlightsHtml: Oceanfront Myrtle Beach hotel with indoor and outdoor pools, plus dog-friendly features like daycare and a playground
deals.pitchHtml:
Hotel at a Glance: Ocean Park Resort

Dogs are truly pampered at this oceanfront hotel in Myrtle Beach. Four-legged family members are allowed in most units for a fee, and they have their own play area.

  • Family-friendly lodging: Standard rooms come with microwaves and mini fridges, and one-bedroom suites have full kitchens.
  • Ocean views can be enjoyed from each unit’s private balcony.
  • Splashy fun with outdoor pools and hot tubs
  • Plan B: The indoor pool area is ideal for cool or rainy days.
  • Where to work out: a fitness room with cardio and weight-training equipment

Myrtle Beach, South Carolina: Sandy Beaches, Golf Courses, and Classic Amusement-Park Rides

Myrtle Beach is the crown jewel of South Carolina’s Grand Strand, a 60-mile stretch of white-sand beaches along the Atlantic seaboard that draws surfers, fishers, and kayakers. The city was named one of the best vacation spots in the United States for a family by USA Today, in part because of its wooden boardwalk, which stretches for more than a mile and buzzes with carnival games and amusement-park rides. Hop into the SkyWheel Ferris wheel’s gondolas, surrounded by more than a million LED lights, for a panoramic view of the city below.

Less than 20 miles south of Myrtle Beach, the tiny fishing village of Murrells Inlet provides a tranquil contrast to the boardwalk’s hustle and bustle. At Brookgreen Gardens, more than 2,000 sculptures stand amid sprawling floral gardens and massive, moss-covered oak trees that have been around for centuries. Murrells Inlet is also home to the Tom Fazio–designed TPC Myrtle Beach golf course, 1 of nearly 100 courses in the area that helped Myrtle Beach earn its title as the seaside golf capital of the world.
